alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Sedgwick and northeastern Sumner Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Hope to near Goddard to 10 miles southwest of Wellington. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Haysville, Wellington, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Sedgwick, Belle Plaine, Oxford, Downtown Wichita, Kechi, Eastborough, Geuda Springs, East Wichita, Northeast Wichita, Mcconnell Air Force Base, South Wichita and Oaklawn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 22. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 8 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
